message.content:
I'll solve this step by step by calculating each financial ratio requested using the given financial statements.

## Free Cash Flow (FCF)
FCF is calculated as Operating Cash Flow minus Capital Expenditures.
- Operating Cash Flow = -6,856,840.58
- Capital Expenditures (Purchase of Fixed Assets) = 666,078.18
- FCF = -6,856,840.58 - 666,078.18 = -7,522,918.76

## Return on Assets (ROA)
ROA = Net Income / Average Total Assets
- Net Income = -2,035,736.52
- Initial Total Assets = 13,000,000.00
- Ending Total Assets = 12,566,098.56
- Average Total Assets = (13,000,000.00 + 12,566,098.56) / 2 = 12,783,049.28
- ROA = -2,035,736.52 / 12,783,049.28 = -0.1592 = -15.92%

## Return on Equity (ROE)
ROE = Net Income / Average Shareholders' Equity
- Net Income = -2,035,736.52
- Initial Equity = 13,000,000.00
- Ending Equity = 10,964,263.48
- Average Equity = (13,000,000.00 + 10,964,263.48) / 2 = 11,982,131.74
- ROE = -2,035,736.52 / 11,982,131.74 = -0.1699 = -16.99%

## Operating Cash Flow to Net Income Ratio
- Operating Cash Flow = -6,856,840.58
- Net Income = -2,035,736.52
- Ratio = -6,856,840.58 / -2,035,736.52 = 3.37

## Net Profit Margin
- Net Profit = -2,035,736.52
- Total Revenue = 6,836,701.10
- Net Profit Margin = -2,035,736.52 / 6,836,701.10 = -0.2978 = -29.78%

## Gross Profit Margin
- Gross Profit = 1,136,701.10
- Total Revenue = 6,836,701.10
- Gross Profit Margin = 1,136,701.10 / 6,836,701.10 = 0.1663 = 16.63%
